p: The R/Pg decreased with the increase of light intensity. Along with the increase of temperature, the differences in R/Pg values among various biocrusts decreased gradually and approached each other under light higher than 25 μmol m −2 s −1. But at 3 μmol m −2 s −1, the R/Pg of AC1 was lowest at −2.5~10 °C, and that of AC2 only next to AC1 at −2.5~0 °C. From −2.5~5 °C, R/Pg of LC2 and MC were higher and MC > LC2. The gaps between AC2 and LC2 and MC decreased at 5 °C. At 10 °C, R/Pg of AC2 was highest. Under 5 μmol m −2 s −1, the R/Pg values were in the order of LC1 > MC > LC2 > AC2 > AC1, and LC1 > MC > AC2 > LC2 > AC1 under 10 μmol m −2 s −1.
